titles.title: Supply Chain Resiliency Act
Supply Chain Resiliency Act

A bill to establish the Office of Supply Chain Resiliency within the Department of Commerce to provide expansion support to companies and supply chains in the United States that are vulnerable to shortages and price increases, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.
Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs. Hearings held.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary:
Supply Chain Resiliency Act
This bill establishes the Office of Supply Chain Resiliency within the Department of Commerce.
The office must identify vulnerabilities in the supply chains for critical products and emerging technologies. It also must provide financial support to manufacturers to expand production of products that are part of supply chains experiencing shortages.
